metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Now, that we have created a virtual environment, we are ready to install Django.
content.html: Now, that we have created a virtual environment, we are ready to install Django.

content.text: Note: Remember to install Django while you are in the virtual environment!
content.html: Note: Remember to install Django while you are in the virtual environment!

content.text: Django is installed using pip, with this command:
content.html: Django is installed using pip, with this command:

content.code_html: (myworld) ... $ python -m pip install Django

content.text: Which will give a result that looks like this (at least on my Windows machine):
content.html: Which will give a result that looks like this (at least on my Windows machine):

content.text: That's it! Now you have installed Django in your new project, running in a virtual environment!
content.html: That's it! Now you have installed Django in your new project, running in a virtual environment!

content.text: You can run this project on either one. There can be some small differences, like some Windows versions prefers py as the first word in the command line, instead of python :
content.html: You can run this project on either one. There can be some small differences, like some Windows versions prefers py as the first word in the command line, instead of python:

content.text: In the rest of this tutorial, we will be using Windows commands with the python keyword.
content.html: In the rest of this tutorial, we will be using Windows commands with the python keyword.

content.text: You can check if Django is installed by asking for its version number like this:
content.html: You can check if Django is installed by asking for its version number like this:

content.code_html: (myworld) C:\Users\Your Name>django-admin --version

content.text: If Django is installed, you will get a result with the version number:
content.html: If Django is installed, you will get a result with the version number:

content.text: Now you are ready to create a Django project in a virtual environment on your computer.
content.html: Now you are ready to create a Django project in a virtual environment on your computer.

content.text: In the next chapters of this tutorial we will create a Django project and look at the various features of Django and hopefully make you a Django developer.
content.html: In the next chapters of this tutorial we will create a Django project and look at the various features of Django and hopefully make you a Django developer.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct syntax for installing Django on a Windows machine?
content.html: What is a correct syntax for installing Django on a Windows machine?
